Header: Tennessee bride 'put gun to groom's head and pulled trigger'
Content: A Tennessee bride has been arrested after police say she pulled a gun from her wedding dress and threatened her new husband just hours after they wed. Kate Elizabeth Prichard, 25, was still in her bridal gown when she was detained at a motel in Murfreesboro. She allegedly drew the 9mm handgun, put it to her husband's head and pulled the trigger. The gun was not loaded, but she later allegedly loaded it and fired into the air, causing onlookers to flee. Witnesses made statements about events preceeding the police's arrival. They said the couple had been drinking and arguing outside the motel.
